text: Has a real distinct banana nose and flavor. A bit spicy ad well. Very tasty. Taphouse.

Bavarian style hefeweizen 
バナナの香り

Draft at tap room. Pours brown with a thin khaki head. Nice banana and clove notes on the nose. Bigger clove on the tongue than I was expecting but thats ok. It makes for a bracing drink. Finishes clean as well. Solid.
Draft sampler pours Amber with a white head. Aroma of malts, cloves and bananas. Taste is malts, grain, and cloves.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2014 This beeer pours a murky orangeish brown with a large off-white head. The aroma is an indulgent blend of bananas, wheat, and a hint of fig, and the taste is a nice, smooth blend of mild sourness with a mild sweetness that is rounded out by a muted banana flavor. The palate has a thick texture, medium body, average carbonation, and a malty finish.

Keg @ Schlafly. Sort of soupy burnt orange color with a small head. Nose is quite estery. Bananas fosters, raisin, caramel and brown bread. Taste is pretty sweet. Glazed donuts, raisin cake. Maple but bar. Banana and wheat. Just a hint of pumpkin pie spices. Medium body, a touch oily. Ok.

Sampled at the RBSG 2014. Right out of the fermentor. It poured an orange color with a white head. The aroma was of wheat, some orange notes and spices. The taste was similar with malts and spices. Very good.

Rated on 3-24-210 (Bottled on 06 25 2009) This beer pours a small very fizzy off-white head that quickly dissipated, hazy amber body, visible carbonation, and virtually no lacing. The aroma is yeast, fruity and spicy. The taste is fruity, spicy and wheat. The palate is mildly tingly and this beer is medium bodied. Overall, this is an easy drinking beer that has a nice spice aroma and flavor. I would consider drinking this beer again.
Mildness all around, so its surprising how much I liked this beer. Nothing stands out, but nothing is offensive. Bready qualities with some honey sweetness. Very nice mouthfeel.

From an old set of notes I found. "Tastes like some Bazooka-Joe bubblegum that had a fling with a wheat-field. I could drink this all day long...lovin it!". That must have been towards the end of the night.

Appearance: tangerine orange under a tight head which fastly fades into nothing. Swirls with a few meager bubbles.

Nose: tangerine, apricots, and peaches. Not overly sweet with a faint nip of tart kiwi. Spice in the back. Leather and fruit skins in the back. Orange honey flambé.

Palate: sweet, tart, then orange oiled leather. Cinnamon and nutmeg. Chew breads in the back laden with apricot and tangelo chunks. Kiwi in the middle and along the edges. Candied ginger. Flambéed peaches and apricots, skin included. Underlying bitterness of orange peel.

Final Thoughts: not at all what I was expecting in many very delicious ways. Im not sure I would classify it as a dunkelweizen but for now, Ill pass on style semantics and keep the beer.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2014 Originally tasted from bottle in nucleated pint glass. Poured a nice, clear copper color with long-lasting beige head. Subtle hops bitterness and aroma, likely noble. Soft, round bready mouthfeel from wheat, nice caramel barley notes as well. Just a little hazy with faint banana and clove yeast esters typical of Dunkelweizen style. A very classy brew.
UPDATE: Tasted again fresh at the 2014 Schlafly Hop In The City festival in a Berliner Weiss sampler glass. Much more banana ester than I remembered, which blended beautifully with the bready mouthfeel and subtle spices. Great brew.
12oz bottle in Chicago. Spritely Belgian wit flavor over tasty balanced backing. Fresh and green - very floral, belgian yeastiness. Sweet to lightly biter finish. Surprisingly tasty!

It pours a murky brownsih gold with a light white head. There is not much retention or lacing. 

The aroma is light with hops and honey, but nothing overpowering.

The taste is also light, small notes of wheat with nothing special. Mouthfeel is light and good drinkablility.
Pours dark brown with tan head, aroma has notes of ginger, clove, and some banana with a touch of chocolate.  Banana, some spice, and a thin but slightly chocolatey finish.  Not bad.

bottle thanks to Creedon pours hazy brown with a thin tan head.  Aroma is wonderful toast, gingerbread, clove, some toffee.  Flavor is rich caramel and toasted malts ending with a sharp carbonation and hot pumpkin spice.  Nice stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2010 Draftt.  For a dunkelweizen, it is a little light in color.  Aroma is wheat, cloves, and citrus.  Notes of banana and other spices.  Palate is a little harsh.  Flavor brings out the banana a little more.
Delicious! floral , fruity, you cant even tell the style really from a first taste. It comes off as a belgian, or maybe a wheat. Nice blend of fruit and spice.
12 ounce bottle.  Pours a cloudy amber with a small biege head.  Aroma of spice, fruit and malt.  Tastes mainly of spice with fruit, wheat and hops.  Nice.  Interesting.

12oz. Bottle:  Aroma of malt, yeast, wheat, light caramel, light nutmeg, yeast, banana, light brown sugar, and slight spice.  Poured copper/amber/brown in color with a small to medium-sized, creamy, dense, off-white/tan head that greatly diminished but lasted throughout as a film on top of the beer as well as around the edges.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Flavor is medium sweet.  Tastes of wheat, Banana, light yeast, slight brown sugar, toffee, light caramel, and slight spice.  Medium body.  Smooth, then slightly dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Wheat, toffee, Banana, yeast finish is lightly dry.

Pours clear and lightly amber with a fruity, spicy, and Belgian like yeast character. Not too dry or sweet and medium bodied. light carbonation lets it go down smooth. A lot better beer than expected.

12oz bottle.  Small beige head atop hazy dark amber body.  Aroma is medium sweet, lemon/pine, light bread.  Taste is moderately sweet, bread, some pine, light caramel, berry.  Light-medium body.  Infected?
Amber orange in color... Aroma is fruity, slightly spicy... Flavor is wheat and potpourri, interesting beer, not my favorite but decent...
Pours a hazy amber with a white head. Spicy smell, mainly nutmeg, cinnammon, and clove. It has a fruity, spicy flavor. It almost tasted like a pumpkin ale to me. It was very enjoyable and smooth.
I sampled this on tap at Schlafly Bottleworks in St. Louis.  Its a medium dark ale, with a licorice and fruity taste.  Good, not amazing.  June 2010.

12 oz. bottle from the Cabin Inn.  Pours a hazy brown-amber with a finger-thick beige head.  Aroma of banana, pineapple, spices, bready malts, wheat, caramel, and clove.  Flavor of banana, spices, bready malts, yeast, wheat, caramel, and tropical fruits.  Medium-bodied, with a wheaty mouthfeel and active but gentle carbonation.  Lots of fruit and spice notes.  This is an unusual one because you honestly dont know what to expect based on the name or label.

I have to say, the high ratings here surprise me. This has a cloudy amber pour with a beige head. Smells & tastes like bananas and chemicals. Not as malty as I expected. Not really very enjoyable to drink.

A fantastic beer by a great brewery.  Nose gives off that great weiss aroma, clove, fruit particularly plumb and raisin.  Palate is spicy and sweet, finishes extremely well with just a hint of hop bitterness.  Overall it was great, and reminded me of Aventinus.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a head of foamy finely sized tan colored bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a softly carbonated hazy orange brown colored body and a good lacing. The aroma was mild orange musty and wheat. The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The flavor contained notes of wheat and hops. A decent one that I would consider buying again.
12 oz bottle. Light orange color, thin white head. Aroma is light wheat, citrus. Flavor is smooth, creamy, nice. Enjoyable.
Parts of a sampler tray at the Taproom.  Not a huge fan of this style of beer, so wasnt taht keen on it
Bottled in St Charles, MO. Pretty nice but maybe a little simple. The aroma and flavours were dominted by clove, banana and baking bread with not much room for anything else.

pours a nice red-orange, hardly any head, tastes of clove and citrus, little hop flavor and feel, a little sweet. flavor diminishes quickly on palate. nice spring time light flavor beer. would pair well with fish and lemon or grilled chicken and fresh pico de galo.
Starts off with a great fruity taste and spice to it but wears itself out by the end of the bottle
banana bread beer. i really dont like dunkels so i guess my opinion dont matter. this will be the last one i try. i just dont like the style
Aroma of banana, clover and bread. Appearance is reddish brown with tan head. Flavor is like sweet banana bread. Palate is creamy and bubbly. Enjoyed.
Pours a cloudy light honey color.  Aroma of yeast and spice with a hint of pine.  Flavorful spice and wheat with subtle pine and citrus finish.  Well balanced and easy to drink.
UPDATED: DEC 15, 2009 Thanks to JK for sharing.  A mild hoppy aroma with a faint white head.  A skunkified wheat aroma.  A similar body.

Draught at the brewpub.  Dark murky amber to light brown at the center with a thin creamy off-white head that leaves thick swathes of lacing.  Aroma of clove and sweet dark fruit.  Flavor is rich, with a bit of dark malt, nice.

Bottle.  Pours hazy copper.  LIttle to no head.  Nose of sweet caramel, hops, hay, and farmhouse funk.  Also a touch of spice in there.  Initial taste is light, bubbly, sweet and refreshing, then followed buy a light sour finish.  Taste is, to me, really dynamite!  Body and mouthfeel are a bit weak, but the initial flavor is so pleasant that it won me over immediately.  I like it a lot.

Poured copper and hazy.  The head was one-finger plus and there was average lacing.  The aroma was a bit of wheat and spice and some sour fruit.  The flavor was sweet caramel malts, dry wheat and more sour on the finish.  Thin body.  Didnt really enjoy it.  Dont know if it was a bad batch or if it was old or what.

Hazy amber pour, moderate off-white head.  Clove, banana, and wheat fill the nose, and the banana, wheat, and spices dance on the tongue.

Theres something out of balance with this beer, the spice overrides the finish.  This one was quite old, bottled last fall...perhaps that leads to the twist of spices.
TAP: hazy amber/gold pour with moderate lacing. Clove on the nose, mild banana on taste, a very smooth, medium-bodied dunkel. I really like this one.
Got this when it first came out but unfortunately I didnt take any tasting notes beyond the numbers.
pretty good brew,.  pours a hazy copper with a fizzy beige head.  notes of spices, pineapple, watermellon, floral hops, bread.  neat.
Bottled on Feb. 14, 2008.  12oz bottle.  Light brown \ amber color.  thin white head.  Some chocolate malts.  Kinda bland & tangy.  Boring.  14 mar 09

Pours dark orange gold with a thick o/w head.
Aroma is orange zest, vanilla tones, a slight earthy sourness, bready malt.
Body is fairly light.
Flavour is more in line with the wheat malt profile, light banana spice, some malt sweetness then a slightly tart-sourness in the finish.

Draught at HBF 09. Hazy copper, almost no head. Sweet carrot casserole aroma, some spinach, slight sweetnsour sauce and basic wheat beer notes too. Flavor is a bit earthy, sourish with wheat, some banana, same sweet carrot as in the aroma. Theres a touch oof peppery hops in the finish. Hollow and a bit watery palate. Im not getting much dunkelweizen notes, and its not that good anyways.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pint Pub, Helsinki. Cloudy amber color, off-white head. Fruity flavor with a touch of wheat. Medium-light body, medium carbonation. Not bad, but uninteresting.
Bottle. Pours an amber color with small white head. Aroma of bananas, malts. Flavor is wheat, bananas, yeast.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in KC. Pours a hazy, orange copper body with a fluffy, foamy, two-finger width head that dissipates at a moderate pace leaving a light amount of sticky lacing. Aroma is mild. Bready wheat, banana, and a touch of spice. Similar flavor that never jumps out at you, but stays balanced and easy. More toffees and light spices come through with lots of banana during a dry finish. Juuuust a hint of sour lemon, but barely noticeable. Moderate aftertaste of fruitcake and a touch of spiced wheat. Medium bodied with a light carbonation. Overall, more fruity and less malty than most dunkels. Seems like a mix between a dunkel and a hefe. Well made, but fairly unexciting.
Bottle, thanks to JK for sharing.  Pours a slightly cloudy orange body with white head.  Aroma and flavor of wheat, orange, banana, and some spice.  Medium bodied with a somewhat sweet malt finish.

Sampled from 12-oz bottle during Akevitts Scandinavian Beer Night and shared by JK. Pours a hazy golden pale colored brew with a thick white head that has nice retention. Aroma of golden grain malt with wheat, a hint of banana esters, yeast and a touch of lemon. Taste is medium bodied with flavors of golden grain malt, banana, a hint of clove, lemon zest and some tropical fruit. Finish is semi-sweet with a banana bread aftertaste that slowly disappears.

Scandinavian Beer Night.  Courtesy of JK.  Orange color with no head.  Aroma of oranges and banana.  Strong banana and wheat flavor.  Not much maltiness for a dunkelwezien, but as a straight up Hefeweizen, very good.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a thin head of poor duration, over a brown gold (SRM 15) slightly cloudy body.....nose of bread, honey, light spice....tastes of sweet roasted malts, toffee, honey, with mild slightly bitter finish....mouth feel is medium. It did not have as much spice as anticipated.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2009 Keg (HBF2009)
Nettle aroma, toffee too. Thinnish body follows the aroma. Some oxidation in the flavours too. Banana finish. Flaws stand out at first but are forgivable in the long run.

(Draught at HBF2009) Amber and hazy. Small white head. Fruitiness and caramell in aroma. Medium bodeid palate with medium carbonation. Sweetness, sourness, fruitiness, bitterness and berries in taste. Sweet aftertaste.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 
Slightly hazy amber color, good creamy beige head. Hoppy nose with sweet banana. Banana, a bit grainy, light yeast and caramel. Not much dunkelweizen, more or less normal weizen.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Hazy amber colour, mediumsized beige huge foamy head. Good lace. Aroma is caramel, fruits, biscuits, nutmeg, and some really sweet notes. Flavour is peach, some caramel, mild wooden notes, birchsap, resin and wheat. Quite strange dunkelweizen.

Why cant a beer get a perfect score?  Here, this one does with me.  I love dunkels and this is incredible.  Finally, an American brewer who uses a German Hefe yeast to brew with.  Awesome banana clove aroma, perfect wheat taste---perfect dunkel weiss!

Bottle courtesy of theisti  thanks Tim!  Pours a hazy amber with a one finger tan head that faded into a thin topper.  The nose is earthy with spice and sweet wheat.  The taste is spice, wheat and a fruity finish with a twang at the end.  Medium bodied.  Unique Dunkel.  Thanks again Tim!

12oz bottle, bottled 2/2/09, courtesy of masterski.  Pours a hazy orangish golden color with small off white head that forms a ring around that wall of my glass.   Nose is sweet wheaty bread and banana.  Some clove spice in there with hints of vanilla and orange zest.  Taste like spiced banana bread with some slight sour and bitter notes in middle and end.  Carbonation is a bit thin and it could use a bit more wheat in the body.

Bottle, picked up at the brewery by my friend Matt. Copper pour with an off-white cap. Bubblegum, cinnamon, earthly pine mulch. A cheerful sort of smell.  Spicy dark caramel with chewy plumskin and persimon fruit. Bright and mouthfilling without being sticky. Soft tannins in the finish. An interesting beer with a lot of friendly yeast character.

spicy aroma with citrus and wheat.  pours a gold/orange under a small head.  moderately carbonated palate.  fairly dry finish.  flavor of caramel and citrus potpourri spices.  i dont recall thinking this was a dunkelweizen though.
Amber pour with big head. Nose of citrus, orange, spice and grains. Flavor is the same with some yeasty notes. Slightly bitter finish.
Nice amber pour. Taste was felt more towards the middle and sides of the tongue; I would have liked more flavor up front and less on the finish.
Bottle. Poured an orange color with a two finger head. Aroma is wheat, orange and spices. Flavor was malts and spices. Body was medium.

courtesy of hwwty4.
Pours orange somewhat cloudy with light beige head.
Aroma is outstanding. Plenty of yeast, wheat farmyard, clove.
Taste thick mouthfeel, wheat, light bitterness, yeasty with notes of banana and esters.
Some spices with good note of clove and coriander. 
Really enjoyed this one.

12 oz. bottle pour into pint glass.  Bottled on 1/07/09.  Pours a very dark orange with a thin fizzy head that mostly diminishes.  Aroma of wheat, spice, banana, and orange.  Flavor is sweet and spicy.  Body is light-medium and sort of flat.  Finish is slightly bitter.
Bottle pours coppery orange with a thick white head. Aroma of bananas clove and a hint of wheat. Flavor is clove and wheat.

Tap.  Quite the enjoyable dunkelweizen. Pours a cloudy orangish brown. Aroma of yeast and spices. Flavor is heavy yeast, slightly sweet pale malt, spices, and citrus. A little more yeast than would be ideal, but a refreshing and drinkable yet flavorful beer nonetheless.

Bottle from acknud. Thanks! Pours a murky orange brown with little trace of a head. The aroma is of banana bread, The flavor is of banana bread, a touch of chocolate, and a little yeast. Some tart wheat notes come off as lemon and round out the finish. Drank easily.

A very interesting drink.  Nearly a cloudy hefe look to it.  A good bit of carbonation and what a flavor.  Whatever flavor is there fades fast.  An easy drink like cheap mass produced to me a bit though.  It isnt coors light, but goes down smooth almost like that.
on tap at schlaflys tap room in st. louis.  orange color, off-white head, some lace.  aroma? bananas!   flavor is bananas, chocolate, hint of spice.  medium bodied.  not bad.

bottle bought from lexington, KY.  same appearance as the last one (the christmas) except without all the yeast at the bottom (which i didnt comment on in the last rating).  this might be infected, since it smells nothing like a dunkelweizen. its pretty sweet and candyish, its malty malty, its bockish.  tastes... hmm... tastes good, though its not at all dunkelweizen.  i mean, no rotting banana at all, which is what i think of.  instead its just bockish without the lager.  i was never good at describing stuff.

12 oz bottle coutesy of Acknud. Pours a hazy amber color with rapidly receding white head. Aroma is malt with spices. Nice mouthfeel, beer has some body to it. Moderate carbonation. Theres a lot going on with this brew. You get flavors of malt, but also some banana, dark wheat, cinamon, nutmeg and allspice.  Good brew, but I dont think Id want to drink several of them.

I chugged this the other night before going out for a fancy dinner. It was pretty good with no noticeable off flavors.  Slightly spiced with some good malt and slight hop presence.  Would like to try this again in a more appropriate setting/manner.  Thanks to strykzone for sending this one!
draft at bottleworks. nice amber color. a good amount of spicy flavors mostly clove, with a bit of sweetness to the finish.

Out of Bottle. Pours dark brown with moderate head. Very fruity aroma with what seems like a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg almost like a spiced beer. Flavor tastes like a spicy dunkelweizen. Very easy to drink. By far the best American Dunkelweizen I’ve ever tasted.

Amber orange brown, thick white head, some lacing. Nice fruity banana/clove aroma - too bad it seemed to fade out quickly. Taste was mostly smooth with some little bubbles of carbonations. Sweet and a little lemon tart with some spicey notes at the finish

Reviewed 11/15/2008 (Tap Sampler @ Schlafly Tap Room, St. Louis, MO):

Pours a blood orange color body, very opaque, very cloudy. Has a flowery aroma, some spices like coriander. Soft mouthfeel, somewhat watery. Has a floral spicy taste. Very tasty.  Fruity, like pear or apple.  Sweet spicy finish

Pours a darker amber with a generous white head. Lots of spices on the nose. Nice wheat flavor with lots of spice (clove, cinnamon, nutmeg perhaps?) and hints of citrus. Nice touch of hops. What a complex brew! Very drinkable as well. This was great. Recommended for sure.

I enjoyed the Schlafly Oktoberfest, so I was eager to try this, as it was suggested by the manager of the liquor store.

Medium tan head. Cloudy, toffee in color.

Wheat, spices and fruit in the nose. Very neutral mouthfeel. Not much going on for all the things you smell, and it’s over quickly.

For such little going on in the mouth, the finish is complex, with the bitter hops balanced nicely by the wheat and spices (cloves or all spice?).

Very drinkable. I’m sure I’ll purchase a case of this when I visit the liquor store next.

Poured from the growler a cloudy orange/light brown color with a solid creamy head.  Very low carbonation, great lacing and the head sticks around for quite a bit.  Aroma is almost all bananas and is very ester heavy with a slight citrus aroma.  Flavor upfront is very dominate of bananas, bitterness in the middle from the hops and finishes with a slight apple cider taste and a very nice alcohol flavor.  Very smooth and the carbonation makes the beer really *pop* in your mouth.

A very light beer, perfext for hot summmer days when you need a refreshing beer.  There is definite citrus and banana flavor, with a clove like spicy finish.  More refreshing and better tasting than american lagers, this really is great for summer.
A fairly light tasting dunkelweizen, but with some nice tasting bannana and spicy flavors.

Tap at Schlafly Bottleworks. Dark amber color with a creamy, slightly lacing, white head. Aromas of sweet malt, suggesting a Belgian tripel. Medium  body with somewhat biting carbonation. Flavor is like a light Belgian amber with something like clove.

I’m not sure what to make of this beer.  A dunkel? dunkelweizen? an amber? belgian yeast flavors?  It’s got a nice yeasty aroma, but all in all the flavors never quite come together for me and the body is too fizzy.  Not for me.
@Indiana Beerfest-pours a rich off white head and gold color.  Aroma is medium/dark malt-caramel, secondary clove.  Taste is wheat/medium/dark malt, secondary clove, orange.  Mild carbonation.

Sampled at the 2008 Music City Brewers Fest. Amber with a creamy off-white head that left some lasting and good lacing. Sweet fruits in the aroma with hits of spices. The flavor is much the same with some caramel coming out also. Light body and slightly watery texture. Enjoyable.
Thanks emacgee for sharing this bottle.  Golden pour with small white head.  Wheaty brew with notes of citrus and banana.  Nothing too special, but a tasty brew.

From the brewpub in St. Louis, this draft pour came came a rich clear amber with small dingy head and good lacing. Mose of cinnamon and ripe citrus, with a smooth and clean mouthfeel. Flavor is strong on the cinnamon and the finish is brisk.  Good beer, and very enjoyable to drink.

Looks like a dark amber ale more than a dunkel. Has a small off-white head that settles to a lasting film and laces like a blanket. Aroma is spicy and fruity and citrus and promises a srtong flavor, which it delivers. The flavor has a crystal wheat malt taste and strong banana yeast influence with some vanilla and clove.  Mouthfeel is medium. Palate is smooth and finish is flavorful and quick.
Poured a clear amber color with two fingers of whitish head.  Aroma is bananas and clove.  Carbonation is good.  Flavor is of bananas and wheat.  Pretty decent beer.
Pours a hazy soft peachy gold with a creamy offwhite head. The nose has banana, clove, sweet and wheat, yeasty. Soft wheaty flavor, banana, bready, yeasty. Soft mouthfeel.

12oz bottle. Bottled on May 28. Bottle conditioned. Served in a shaker pint. Pours a hazy amber with two fingers of off white head. Plenty of carbonation. Some clove and wheat in aroma. Light to medium bodied. Nice and spicy flavor. A little caramel malt. Spritzy mouthfeel. A little wheat bite to it. Very drinkable, a great summer beer.

Appearance: Pours a clear, amber body with a thin, wispy, white head.

Smell: Dark wheat malt aroma with a touch of caramel and notes of sliced bananas, dried apricots, and spices.

Taste: Malted wheat, slightly tangy, and with a brief, though satisfying sugary sweetness. Light fruitiness. Tiny pinch of spice. Very restrained bitterness present. Sweetish finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: No doubt a fine drinkable beer, but woefully understated for such an auspicious occasion.

On tap at brewery.  Pours a clouded amber golden.  Thicker head retention around the rim.  Malt heavy bananaish aroma with a touch of spice.  Flavors are very present, with a bubblegummy undertone, while remaining in that nice banana/close department.  Decent beer, definitely could ask for more clear tones as to where they’re going.

100th rating for this brew, and my rating is right at the avg (3.43).  Bottled Dec 14 07.  Wheat and a big Juicy Fruit bubblegum aroma, some sweet banana and orange rind.  Touch of clove and grape, dash of misc spices - nutmeg?  Hazy orange-chestnut body with a soapish tan head.  Taste is crisp and bubbly, then creamy, wheaten and drying with lots of lemon-orange [dominate flavors, along with the wheat] and a very light touch of caramel and cocoa.  Some very nice deft acidity and a medium body.  Unusual and style-defying - and a lot of fun

Orangeish brown color, cloudy.  Fluffy, fairly persistant head.  Nose of plums and wood with some floral notes.  Rich taste with notes of bananas, plums, citrus, and wood.  Hoppy finish.  The taste was somewhat reminicent of a Belgian Abby ale, almost a mix of a Dubbel and a Triple.  Very good.  Best Ive had from St. Louis Brewery.

12oz bottle. Attractive aroma of banana bread with hints of clove and anise. Poured a hazy brownish-orange color. The head was off white with good retention. Delicately sweet on the tongue. Light to medium bodied. Clove and banana came out again in the flavor. There was also a hint of bacon and a light citrusy note emerged at the end. Pretty tasty.

Bottle thanks to kwoeltje.
Pours a cloudy amber with beige head, ok retention. Aroma of banana and cereal. Flavor of bannana and clove, some spice. Mouthfeel of high carbonation....pretty good stuff overall.

bottle thanks to swalden_28.  pours a cloudy amber with a beige head.  minimum retention.  aroma has strong notes of banana.  a bit hoppy. aftertaste reminds me of cheap vodka.    not a big fan of this one.

12 oz. bottle into a pint glass.  Hazy honey brown with descent off-white head that denigrates very rapidly.  Very sweet wheat and malt aroma with some banana notes - not very experienced with dunkelweizen, but  smells a bit to sweet for my taste. Flavors include hints of nuts, sweet malt, very subtle citrus and cider notes, but really not much potent flavor.  The alcohol is hidden well though.  Smooth, soft, and not much carbonation or body on the palate.
Sweet nectar flavor..tasty, but not very strong. Wheat and fruit. Its alright.
I dont know that this is a dunkelweizen, per se. To me its a very interesting mix of styles. Lots of wheat character, with some umami type elements. Nice nose of hops and good amber color.
Poured a hazy amber color with a good white head and good lacing on glass. Aroma is very wheaty. Flavor of wheat and esters from yeast. Good mouthfeel and easy to drink. A pretty good beer.

Brought to you by the Todd Barns foundation. Dont need no coaxing here. This one pushes froth to the ceiling even in the dead of a winter chilled fridge. Reducing slowly I see the hazy amber liquidity stabilize. Smells just like freshly opened bubblegum. Medium nectar with mild carbonation, kinda flat actually. Its spiced and all gummed up for sure but lacks depth. The finish is bittered mildly and lingers in spice.

On tap at the Tap Room, cloudy amber hue, with a ring of white head, yeasty, fruity nose of ripe apple, and faint bananas, with a wheaty, toasty, biscuity malt accent, with a hint of cinnamon and clove spiciness in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, acidic fruity, spicy, toasty and caramelized malt character, with some cinnamon, nutmeg notes, some fruity flavors of ripe apple and banana, with a mild flowery hop citrusy accent, leading towards a malty, fruity, lingering hop bitterness finish.

Poured a light hazy amber color with decent white head that hung around for a while. Aroma is wheaty with citrus notes also coming through. Taste is also of wheat, citrus, and spices. Tastes a bit like a weizenbock to me. Mouthfeel is pleasant and lacing on glass was good. Easy drinker and thirst quencher.

12oz bottle.  Cloudy amber with large tan slowly disappearing head and nice lacing in my Weiss glass.  Strong bananas to go with clove & wheat.  Taste of wheat and banana.  Decent finish.  Semi-nondescript, though I seemed liked this one.

Smells and tastes a lot like pumpkin stew!  Even looks like it - cloudy dark orange color, as in pumpkin orange.  Nose of sweetened, candied, herbal squash meat and pumpkin bread, and basically the same flavor... fruity banana, nuts, bread, cardamom, etc.  Weird, interesting, and ultimately good.
Pretty pour.  Amber color with a slight haze and small white head. Aroma is slight but I detect spices and malt.  Taste is of oranges, cinnamon, allspice and clove.

Sample at the brewpub. This beer pours a mostly clear dark orange color with a wispy off-white head that diminishes quickly. Spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma if yeast and orange peels, along with some malt. Light, clean body with a zesty character. Flavors of citrus, spices and yeast are present along with some doughy malt. The finish is spice and yeast with a mild citrus aftertaste. Decent overall.
Poured a hazed copper with an off-white head.  wheaty lemon/citrus notes with a mild spice.  Wheaty citrus flavor mixed with some caramel malt and light fruit.

Bottle. Too much spice and too many flavors that just dont gel. Medium amber body. Small, off-white head. Strong aroma of clove and sweet banana with other notes of cookies and grain. The flavor is moderately sweet. Very little bitterness. Thin to medium body with a watery texture. Moderate carbonation. Not my favorite from Saint Lewis Brewery.
Pours amber with a thin white head.  Smells of bananas, bubblegum, lots of sugar, cloves.  Tastes spicy with lots of bubblegum and tea.  Over the top spicy finish.
I enjoyed this bubblegumbananacottoncandy brew a lot more than I ussually like those flavors in my beer. Sweet, wheat and all the above really shine. Light body and light flavors but still very good.
Bottle, thanks to yobdoog.  Opaque orange pour, some film on top.  Aroma is sweet wheat malt, bubblegum, clove.  The flavor is the same; good and sweet, but slightly grainy also.

Thanks to yobdoog for bringing this out.  Aroma is very banana-laden, clove and a bit of pear. Lightly smokey with a soft wheatiness on the back.  The palate seems quite watery to me though.  The flavour is sweet and fruity, some banana and clove with a toasted maltiness.
Lots of banana to go along with a sulfuric flavor. Somewhat lively and pretty damn tasty. Id drink this again.

Bottle courtesy of Duane. Bottled on Sep 9th 07. Murky pumpkin pie color, nice tan head, decent lacing. Really nice aroma of banana, chewy-yeasty bread and faint clove. Flavor much the same. Nice chewy banana bread character, yeasty dough through the middle, finish has some faint pepper, and some american wheat tartness type flavor, I dont really care for. Nice chewy mouthfeel, residuel banana burps. Dont understand the ratings on this? Maybe bad bottles around or something? Other than the tartness near the finish, this is a really solid brew. Nice surprise Duane!!
At the brewpub 12/3/07.  Pours orange-amber with off-white head.  Very malty.
Bottle. Orange colour with an off-white head. Sweet malty aroma with yeasty notes. Sweet malty taste with hints of fennel.

bottle.  pours hazy amber, little head, no lacing.  aromas of lemon zest, and creamy lemon cake bars, theres also some funky yeast going on in the aroma.  also, butter hits the nose too.  tastes extremely zesty, mainly lemon rind.  almost grainy on the palate, with a hint of allspice, but the finish is rather thin, a bit mineral-esque, a bit too much so for my tastes.    its easy to knock back a few, but only if im preoccupied.  its a good beer with a pretty good flavor, just not my personal preference.

Bottle: Pours a hazy dark copper amber with a small froth of wispy off-white head.  Sweet dark caramel malt and doughy German yeast dominate the aroma.  Starts with good fullness and an authentic German malty sweetness toward a lightly bittersweet chewy doughy finish.  Very true to style and enjoyable.
Pours red/amber with quickly dissapating head.  Aroma with lots of strawberry and spices.  Taste is kind of fruity with spices.  Kind of like a cider or a spiced wine in flavor.  Not that great.

Beautiful aroma and appearance.  First sip leaves me a bit disappointed.  After a couple more sips, all I can think is this beer is gonna hurt my stomach."  fruity flavor, but not much of it (flavor that is).

Aroma is spicy with malt, oatmeal, strawberries, and a mild hoppiness.  Reddish amber color with a tan head.  Taste is coppery.  Roasted malt.  sharp initial bite - zesty and peppery.  Slightly hay-like bitter dryness.  Palate is well carbonated, light, and slightly dry.  Great aroma but weaker flavor overall.

Draft sample at Schlafly Bottleworks. Thick orange haze with a nice skin of lacy foam. Smell of lemon and spices, some of which may be from advertised Tettnang hops. Also hides some mutant hefe yeast among its amber malt. Finish suggests allspice and coriander, but stays low in esters.

12oz bottle. very cloudy orange copper color with a short lived light tan head. yeasty spicy aroma has a fresh cut green apple quality. quite pleasing indeed. fruity with lively carbonation and a medium body. not sticky or cloying. very autumn like, i can see this with pumpkin pie or garlic roasted potatoes and a good roast.  spicy ginger like finish is crisp and satisfying. good dark wheat.

bottle from drmatt: pours lively orange hue with a very carbonated quick diminishg white head. aroma is spicey (clove) and yeasty with touches of wheat and banana sweet fruitinees. flavour is is slightly spicey with sweet malts and some wheat malt touches of fruit. body is a little light and the carbonation is high. not overpowering n any aspect of flavour wo very well rounded and easy to drink.

Hazy orange amber body with a small beige head. Spicy aroma of clove, pepper, and ginger with some fruity banana notes. Medium body with zesty carbonation. Taste is quite spicy. Almost thought I had a pumpkin ale here. Ginger, clove, allspice, and cinnamon notes swirl around the palate. Ripe banana fruitiness and wheat cracker form a nice base. Very tasty. Another interesting ale from Schlafly.

Pours hazy amber with a fully receding off-white head. Aroma of light caramel, banana, toffee. Taste is lightly sweet, yeasty with notes of banana and clove. Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied, lively carbonation. Very enjoyable dunkelweizen.
On tap in St. Louis. Hazy amber with a off-white head. Nose is fruity and spicey. Flavor is strongly bananas.
Strong taste of a pale ale with some wheat thrown in. Not hoppy at all. Is this really a dunkelweizen? Tastes a lot like a pale with this subtle wheat flavor. Not bad. Average.

Rating 1072, on tap at the Schlafly Bottleworks in Maplewood MO. Hazy darker amber with a medium sized medium lasting whiteish head that left good lacing on the glass. Nose is grains with just a touch of spice. Taste has more malts and wheat. Copper finishes off. Drinkable and pleasant.

Incredible!  Is this the first bottle of beer ever made in St. Louis that Ive enjoyed>  sweet, that special lightness from a wheat alewith the banana and cloves..but Schlafly doesnt even know its a dunkleweizen?  amber colored ale?

Name: Schlafly #15
Date: 07/21/2007
Mode: Draft
Source: Brewfest, Indy

opaque burnt orange, big dense creamy head, lots of lace, 
sweet banana and orange aroma on a nice chocolate base, 
sweet banana and orange flavor, chocolate adds depth and is pulled out by the sweetness, very light bitterness adds all the needed balance, 

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 14/20
Rating: 3.6/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: **4

On tap at Schlafly Tap Room.  Poured hazy peachy-caramel with a short, well-retained cap of white head.  Aroma was of soft banana and caramel sweetness with an enjoyable grainy, wheaty backing.. touches of raisin and orange peel waft through as well.  Flavor was of sweet toasted banana with some lighter fruits.. prickly wheat tartness with citrus and dry grassy bitterness as accents.. quite tasty!  Just less than medium-bodied.. wheaty tartness was a bit sharp at times.  Overall a very good beer!
Poured a rich amber color.  Aroam was great with banana and spice.  Flavor didnt match the aroma in terms of quality; relied too heavily on the spice.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Quality beer.

Bottle at DLD: A muddy deep amber hue with orange highlights and a small but fading creamy head. The aroma has notes of banana, clove, walnut, toasted malt, rye bread, and some earthy yeast esters. The taste is more towards the weizen side than the dunkel with a fruity and spice tone at the forefront. Very wheat and rye bread flavors with a spicy finish. The mouth feel is reserved and smooth. A solid drinking brew, try one.

Bottle: Poured a dark orange-ish amber with a quickly disappearing head with moderate lacing.  The aroma is very yeasty like a weizen, and indeed this drinks like one.  Yeasty, spicy, fruity.  Interesting hybrid brew, something between a dunkelweizen and an American amber ale.  Far too spicy for the masses.  (#3035, 7/17/2007)

This dunkel pours a medium brown color from a 12oz bottle. Large sized white foamy head. Aroma is biscuit, bread, a touch floral and sweet. A medium to light bodied dunkel. Malts are caramel, bready and sweet. Hops are slightly earthy. Nice balance. Smooth taste. Nice, but not overpowering, malt sweetness throughout. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.
Tap - Copper with tan head.  Much better at the brewpub than in bottle.  Banana and clove notes

12 ounce bottled on Nov 12 2006.  Served into a shaker glass.  Murkey amber with lots of yeast sediment, and a dense whipped white head.  Big aroma of caramelized banana and clove.  Fluffy mouthfeel.  Flavor starts clove to banana, and then back.  It lingers a bit.  Not bad at all.  I wonder whats up with Schafly lately.

On tap at the Parkville Microbrew Festival. Pours amber in color with an off-white sticky head.  Very orangey aroma. This has a nice chewy palate, but drinks smooth and mellow. A lot of fruity orange flavors emerge. It has lots of esters- wheat, coriander, and banana.

12 oz bottle pours amber with a short offwhite head.  Aromas of bubblegum, wheat, and some slight grassy hops.  Flavor is clove, bubblegum and some bannana with those grassy hops at the back of the sip. Fizzy on the palate and slightly overcarbonated.

I read the label on this beer and saw amber-colored ale and immediately was disappointed. Then I opened it up and drank one while watching "Thank God Youre Here" and thought to myself after the first sniff, this isnt an ordinary amber, this is a freaking dunkelweizen. light banana, bubblegum and clove in the nose and flavor. very herbal sensation while swishing in the mouth and a grassiness/weediness in the finish and aftertaste. not a bad beer.

(Bottle) Pours an amber color with a small tan head. Aroma of fruit and some yeast. Taste is vaguely similar, and more complex than I expected. Some light spice and vanilla in there as well. Mouthfeel is a little weak, but good lacing. All in all, one of their better beers, but not really what I would consider to be a dunkelweizen.

12 oz bottle. Pours hazy red copper with beige head. The aroma is very spicy, clove, anise, nutmeg, pepper, some toffee, and flax muffins. The flavor is sharp and zesty up front, a bit surprisingly. Then the spices kick in, same ones as in the nose, but less pronounced. Toasty malt is in there, too, especially toward the finish. The finish is a bit watery, though. Some peachy esters come out as it warms. Ok.

Bottle. Pours a hazy amber/orange with a frothy off-white head. Begins to clear as the yeast settles. The aroma is of citrus and banana bread; the palate is light, thin and amazingly smooth with a slightly dry finish. Tastes like bananas and oranges with a smooth, crisp, wheat finish. I really like this one.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2009 sample from bottle at DLD - Hazy amber pour, fluffly enduring head, and a yeast aroma with a touch of citrus.  The flavor is sweet with yeast and some spice along with mild citrus notes.  Medium bodied and lively on the palate.

Bottle. Hazy orange pour with a light tan head. Pungent aroma of banana and wheat with some pale malt. Flavors of wheat, banana, some spices and light fruitiness. Medium body, malty with a odd light sourness and a dry finish.
Bottle pours a clear amber with a beige head.  Carmel malts and fruit in the nose.  Light bodied with cookie, carmel, citrus flavors and a little spice.  Not bad but nothing special either.
Bottle: Slightly hazy copper color with an off white head. Aroma, wheat and some fruity notes. Flavor, caramel, wheat, spice and some fruits.

Draft at Flying Saucer. Pours  a murky brown with a frothy retentive tan head. Aroma of banana esters. Initial flavor of wheat muffins and banana, with more clove and spice mid palate. Finish is clean with notes of vanilla. This was very enjoyable, but minor league in the world of dunkels. This needed a bit more  body and texture, but the flavors were good.
Hazy amber/orange color with a beige head. Aroma of spices and cake/sweet bread. Flavor of spices, banana and wheat.

Light copper color with a big bubbled light beige head. Dry malt and grass aromas. Some hints of spice, but that of a tin that has set in my mothers cupboard for far too many years. A wheat field surrounded by a flower garden, as light sweet wheat and mild sweet flowers are the first thoughts. Bland comes to mind the rest of the way through. Some very, very mild spice and wheat bread flavors in the finish and short linger. I think this is a good example of a wheat beer brewed with a standard ale yeast producing an a boring american dunkelweizen. Certainly not bad, but certainly nothing exciting.
Pours a hazy amber with a white head.  Spicy smell, mainly nutmeg, cinnammon, and clove.  It has a fruity, spicy flavor.  It almost tasted like a pumpkin ale to me.  It was very enjoyable and smooth.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2010 Big banana nose.  Moderately sweet, phenolic, with buffered acidity.  It feints towards being too edgy, then relents.  Cloudy, tea-brown.  Some homebrewish/green qualities.  Bubblegum finish, medium body.  On tap, Flying Saucer, Nashville.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2007 Revised rating 8/17/07.  12 oz. bottle.  Pour is clear dark orange with a quickly fading off white head.  Aroma is coriander spice and some malt.  Taste is easy drinking, spice, malt and a very light body.  new rating [3.5]


Original rating 3/28/07.  Bottle.  Tasted at Schlafly tasting at the Lukas KCMO wine bar.  Pour is brown, with some settling.  Aroma has a decent spice to it, which really came out in the initial taste.  Schlafly explained the additive was coriander, but I tasted more of a bubblegum and citrus fruit sweetness to it.  Some nutmeg in there as well.  Overall an interesting brew. [3.3]

Draught at Flying Saucer-Nashville.  Pours hazy brown with spare fizzy off-white head, somewhat lasting, fair lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (cereal, caramel), light hops (grass), heavy yeast (dough, barn) with notes of apple, banana and honey.  Medium bodied, thin texture, soft carbonation and a smooth finish.  Moderate sweetness, light acidity and bitterness; roasted caramel malt, wheat and banana flavors.

aroma of white pepper, chocolate malt, banana, wheat, and cloves and nutmeg.  appearance is blood orange with creamy eggshell head.  the flavor is banana, wheat, gumball, and cloves, with some nutmeg and juniper berries.  yum
On tap at the brewpub. Appearance was cloudy cider with a white head. Aroma was well spiced, banana, and cloves. Flavor was strongly spiced, some banana, and some sweetness. Hoppy finish.

Bottle courtesy Brett and Hannah. Pour was cloudy brown, nice initial head, solid lacing. The aroma was caramel, light roast, bananas. Flavor was outstanding, light caramel, a touch of roast, firm banana support (esp. for a dunkelweizen), notes of chocolate, cinnamon, and vanilla. Mouthfeel was perfectly, not heavy, yet still creamy smooth. Two thumbs up here on this one, perhaps my favorite of the style? Thanks, Brett and Hannah!

aroma bananas and clove with sweet light malts.  taste is much the same with lots of banana and a little bit of medium kilned malts.  lingering spicy finish.  not my thing.  appreciate it for what it is but did not enjoy it.

Amber orange brown, thick white head, some lacing.  Nice fruity banana/clove aroma - too bad it seemed to fade out quickly.  Taste was mostly smooth with some little bubbles of carbonations.  Sweet and a little lemon tart with some spicey notes at the finish.

Bottle. Poured a clear orange/brown color with a large light brown head that was mostly lasting and produced excellent lacing. Good banana and spice aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Good hefe sweet flavor with an average sweet finish of moderate duration. Soft drinkable brew.

From a twelve ounce bottle purchased at "Liquor Direct" in Covington, Kentucky - This one poured a cloudy orange brew rampant with the proper banana-and-cloves aroma of a hefe and a tall, thin off-white head of foam. Tastewise, this is a pretty good dark hefeweizen, with a complex, spicey-sweet taste that sharpens at the finish. Its a good beer!

Bottle.  Orange body with a bit of a haze and a very thin head.  Aromas are lush with bananas and cloves with a yeasty bread backdrop.  Flavor has a burst of coriander spicing up front and then slips into a cloves and banana finish after passing through a bit of a yeasty transition.  There is a touch of a lemony flavoring throughout.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: The bodys a light brown with an orange tint and it supports a tall, creamy pale beige head.  It smells of ripe bananas and clove and has a light sourness to it.  The flavor is all sweet - banana, wheat, a dab of chocolate -  and has the addition of clove and nutmeg.  A mild lemon twist appears at the finish.  Pretty decent brew.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Tuck Wines, Sprirts, & Beverages, Bloomington, IL<font size=-1>

Bottle from Beerdrenched; Thanks; Nose of bananas, cloves, nutmeg, and some wheaty breadiness; Great smelling nose; slightly hazed copper with a medium straw colored head; flavor shows the bananas especially, with some cloves in the light medium body with a light fruity chocolate note in the finish. Good Dunkelweisen.

Dark Copper. Massive 4-Vinyl Guiacol presence in the nose (Sweet Nutmeg and Cloves) with some Banana. Just a bit of a sourness that was nicely balanced in and not overpowering. By the end of the glass there was a bit of a DMS-like aroma. Really not a Dunklewiezen with that kind of profile, but a solid beer.

Dark brown in color with almost no head.  Aroma is lots of clove.  Flavor is more subtle than expected and has banana, clove, and some lemon.  Some earthiness is clearly evident as well.  This was a very drinkable beer that was full of fruit and typical hefe flavors.

poured from a 12oz. bottle into a snifter glass

A: Pours a nice looking copper/orange color with a stark white head. Goes away quickly but leaves some nice lacing.

S: Wow, this beer pretty much smells overwhelmingly like ripened bananas, so if you like that thing, thisll smell go to you.

T: A rather subtle beer, though there is a sour tartness to it that has me wondering if Ive gotten an "off" bottle or not. A nice sweet breadiness beneath that saves the day though, and leaves a tasty short finish.

M: Like many in the weiss world, this beer has a crisp, light, well-carbonated feel to it.

D: Probably not a beer Id return to, though I would be interested to find out if its supposed to taste this way.
Nice Ale that pours an amber color and a bit of a fruity aroma.  The carbonation adds to the crisp spicy finish.

Bottle... Cloudy amber ale with a small, fizzy, white head. Fruity, wheat nose with clove phenols and banana esters. Sweet, spicy flavor. Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and prickly carbonation. Finishes sweet, but crisp. Thanks to vyvvy for the bottle!

POurs a hazy amber with a massive, lasting head.  Aroma is sweet, spicy wheat notes, a somewaht plasticky yeast note, bananas, lemon, and coriander.  Flavor is immense and wonderful.  Initial breadiness is followed by a yeasty note (again, a little odd but works well), then bananas, a tart lemony section, toasted wheat bread, and a long, very bitter finish.  Ill go out on a limb and declare this the greatest beer to contain wheat that Ive ever had.

12oz. bottle.  Aroma is comprised of a blend of softly sweet, milky caramel and dark wheat malts along with German-style yeast attributes, providing plenty of spicy clove and some lighter banana esters, and features some faint lemon-like citrus, honey and earthiness underneath.  Hazy dark amber color, with a lasting, fine, creamy, off-white head and a dusting of greyish sediment.  Rather well-balanced flavors here, with a toasty, sweet malt presence, abundantly spicy yeast character and a gentle citric tinge, finishing surprisingly long with a hint of chocolate.  Smoothly textured mouthfeel with a medium body.  Fairly well-rendered take on the style and eminently drinkable.

Nov 06 Bottle. Beer is clear, medium caramel-amber brown colored. Head is initially small, off-white, frothy. Diminishes mostly and rapidly.

The aroma is similar to a Hefe. Malty with light notes of toasted grain, shortbread; Hoppy with a trace-to-light grassy mint note; Yeasty with a trace of sweet dough; Trace notes of cinnamon, banana, clove, light note of plastic.

The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter, lightly acidic with a longish, lightly bitter, lightly acidic, lightly sweet, unclean-feeling finish.

The body is medium, the texture is watery and the carbonation is lively. Forgettable.

Nov 06 bottling. Head is initially small, frothy/fizzy, off-white, mostly diminishing. Body is medium amber. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain, cookie), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of gum, banana, clove. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Not bad, but I found it difficult to conjure affection for any of its qualities.

On tap at the tap room. Aroma is full of esters: banana and bubblegum.  Slight hint of spice, fairly wheat-y.  Super cloudy amber with a thin, off-white head.  Sweet bubblegum flavors and some spice.  Like a dark hefeweizen, but more sweet and candy-like.  Medium-light body with a slight creaminess to it.  Easy to drink, but nothing interesting or worth seeking out again.

aroma... not much to smell. Reddish brown color. Obvious carbonation. You can only just barely see through it. Its got a tea like taste. Not bad at all, some bitterness. Slight sweetness. Definite beery flavor but a slight hint of tea. Watery, goes down easy. Can taste all over my tongue. I can feel it all the way down. I like it alot

12oz bottle.  Unfiltered and sedimanted.  Ruby red with a brown and orange tint.  Off-white thick clinging head.  Strong yeast aromas.  Lotta banana and clove.  Typical bavarian hefe.  Slight caramel aroma.  Grainy and medium bodied.  Nice yeast flavor.  Sweet malt/wheat initial flavor.  Crisp and smooth with a fruity ester flavor.  Finish is sweet with a slight bitter hop flavor.  Clinging white lacing on the glass.  Well done Schlafly!

From a bottle purchased at Lukas Liquor in KC. The body is dark copper and orange with a light khaki head. The aroma is sweet with some oranges and a little bit of banana. There is some decent clove smell in here too. The taste has some mild apples and a little bit of clove spice in the finish. A hint of funky hay sneaks in, but it is overwhelmed with the hefe character. There is not much else going on here. It is simple and not very exciting. Come on Schlafly, you can do better.

draft at the Schlafly Tap Room.  pours a hazy brown with a great looking creamy tan head.  aroma and flavor has all the usual weizen characteristics of banana, clove and some bubblegum.  also, quite yeasty, both in aroma and in the flavor and has a bit of a spicy finish.  a tasty and unique brew from Schlafly.

Interesting beer for my first review.  It has a flavor similar to NBs 2 below and saison.  Its kind of a spicy citrus dry amer ale.  Little sweetness if any.  Not too bad. Iit is very drinkable and I would purchase again!

what an odd mix.  amber belgian wit german hefe?  its an easy drinker, but an odd choice for an anniversary.  not a belgian wit, not a dunkelweizen, not an american wheat, not an amber, not a hefe, but with hefe yeast and belgian spices.  weird but good, better a summer than a winter brew
(bottle) slightly hazy amber-orange. Aroma of yeast and spice. Flavor is yeast, spice, some coriander.

12 oz Bottle, "Bottled with Love on 10/13/2006"  Dark amber pour with a decent sized head.  Spicy, estery, bubblegum aroma.  Nice light fruity taste, bananas, bubblegum, yeast, lightly spicy finish.  An excellent example of what an American Wheat can be from Schlafly.

From the bottle pours a dark amber color with a medium head.  Smells of coriander, orange peel, spice and yeast.  Taste matches the aroma.  A great new one from Schlafly.  Cool label on the bottle.  Im really glad they have bottles this.

At the Taproom, from the tap, of course, served in a Schlafly pint glass.

Poured a murky orangey amber with foamy, creamy white head that settled into a thin sudsy lacing, fair amount of ringed sticking.

Aromas of bananas and clove, a light fruitiness and coriander, and a nice dunkel-like wheaty.

Moderate carbonation and malty crisp, velvety smooth medium bodied mouthfeel, again, very nice.

Delicious tasting, clove and banana at first, followed by the wheat malts, as it warms the coriander and orange peel start to come out, a light spiciness towards the end and a yeasty, malty finish.

Easy drinkability on this one, highly quaffable, I could spend a long night sipping this brew, an excellent dark wheat.

tap at the brewpub and at Ciceros.  I was definately suprised by this one!  murky red/borwn with a small fizzy white head.  room doesnt have good lighting for an appearnace rating.  banana, clove, spicy nose with lots of banana esters and lightly phenolic.  wow!  thats alot of banana flavor there with tons of nice undertones of cinnamon, nutmeg, corriander and clove.  Palate is somewhat light in carbonation for the style, which actually helps me out.  long finish of banana and corriander.  some light grainy malts in there as well.  awesome version of the style.  Copper kettle, eat your heart out.   One of the best i have had from Schlafly for shure.

Pour is a hazy brown with a small tan head.  Aroma is very much corriander with a touch of spice.  Flavor is more in the clove catagory with orange peel and a nice banana finish.  Very tasty and well done.
Not really my style of beer.  An abundance of banana and belgiumy flavors.  A good, well crafted beer, but not what I was looking for.  Sweet, biscuit, banana and spices.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2006 On draught at the Tap Room.  Pours a cloudy pale orangeish brown with a fairly substantial off-white head. Aroma is coriander and orange peel with a sweet malt, bubblegum, chocolate, and biscuit flavor.  Yeah I know, sounds strange, but this is a well balanced brew and those flavors work well together.  Another good one from the Schlafly crew.  UPDATE:  Less tangy, and a more bready and banana flavor evident from the bottle.

On tap at the brewpub - soon to be a year round in bottles according to the staff.  Poured dark hazy amber with a moderate tan head.  Aroma had dark rich wheat with a light sweetness.  Medium body with a rich feel at the beginning and a fairly crisp finish.  There is a small amount of carbonation.  Taste starts with rich wheat, some orange hidden underneath for a touch of citrus flavor.  It is quite smooth, but there are some crisp characteristics.  The finish brings out cloves that complement the other flavors quite well.  A bit more citrus starts showing through.  The carbonation it does have accentuates the clove and citrus.  Further down I detected a bit of a papery taste on the finish - this was the only negative I had with the beer and it wasnt a very dominant flavor.  This is a well done and unique beer from the St. Louis staple.
